question.title: android java:create a file txt on a sd mount,not on internal sd,how to do?
question.body: I'd like to create a program to store a txt file on the SD card mounted on a tablet. So far, I've only been able to create this file on the internal SD card, and I can't find any solutions online. Does anyone have a Java example to show me?

question_comments.body: I do not have a Java example of ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT / ActivityResultContracts.CreateDocument, because Android development largely moved to Kotlin several years ago.

i try getExternalFilesDirs() but it return only 1 file.i have a sd card mount on my device.for  (ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT / ActivityResultContracts.CreateDocument),if you have an code exemple, i would like to test it ,because i try lot of things ,but ,i m beginner in android and java and i don t know how to do this ;Thank you for your reply

Use getExternalFilesDirs() on Context -- if that returns 2 or more File objects, the second and subsequent ones represent directories on removable media that you can use. Or, use the Storage Access Framework (ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT / ActivityResultContracts.CreateDocument) and let the user decide where on the user's device or the user's cloud storage you should store the user's content.
